result.execSummary:
The defendant Brenda Anne Mikkelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with Counts 1 and 2 in15CF194.
Defendant to report to Probation today October 13, 2015.
Probation may be transferred to Polk County.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation. 



In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Counts 1 & 2 15CF194

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Brenda Anne Mikkelson appeared.  Court called at 2:08 p.m.  Set for PTC.  Includes case 15CF194 & 15CF209.  There is an agreement.  Attorney Andrea recites the agreement.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 in 15CF194 to Misdemeanor Theft and amend Ct. 1 in 15CF209 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.   Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty in 15CF209.  DE pleads No Contest to the amended Ct 1 in 15CF209.  No contest pleas are entered.  Court reviews the police report.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1 in 15CF209.  Court reads the charges and maximum penalties in 15CF194.  DE pleads in 15CF194 No Contest to the amended Ct 1. & No Contest to Ct. 2.  No contest pleas are entered.  Court reviews the police report.  Crt accepts the plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct. 1 and Adjudicated guilty of Ct. 2.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 15CF209 to run concurrent with Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 in 15CF194
S/W 2 years probation with conditions

-It is hereby ordered the defendant have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons, Katie Y. or Broden F. or the residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Court costs and the DNA surcharge total $1,329.00 for the 3 counts to be paid through the DOC

- Probation can be transferred to Polk County
- DE to report to probation today 10/13/15
- Bail bond remains in effect until DE reports to probation and then is vacated.

- Credit for 58 days credit if revoked
- 20 days to appeal

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Brenda Anne Mikkelson appeared.  Court called at 10:50 a.m.  Includes case 15CF194 & 15CF209.  State is asking for more time for a resolution.  Continue PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 10:52 a.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Filed by Def. Re: status of case. km

Bond is to be Co-Signed by Linda Hoffbeck 

INCLUDES 15CF194 & 15CF209

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Katie Y. or Broden F. or the residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Brenda Anne Mikkelson did not appear.  Court called at 10:30 a.m.  Set for PTC.  Includes case 15CF194 & 15CF209.  DE is in custody in Polk County. Court issues a bench warrant.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea, DF:  Brenda Anne Mikkelson appeared.  Court called at 10:56 a.m.  Set for preliminary hearing on 15CF194 & 15CF209 (STC).  Attorney Andrea makes statement. Attorney Andrea is asking to schedule the cases out for PTCs.  ADA Sortedahl advises the court if the DE is requesting a preliminary hearing on 15CF194 he advises there is a witness coming in to testify for todays scheduled prelim.  Court will recess and recall at the scheduled time of the preliminary hearing.  Recess at 10:57 a.m.  Case recalled at 11:16 a.m. S/T of Deputy Ryan Kelly of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department.  Direct by ADA Sortedahl.  Cross by Attorney Andrea.   Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  State files Information with the court.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 11:25 a.m. Case recalled at 11:26 a.m. Court proceeds to arraignment on 15CF194.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Speedy trial is waived.  Set out for PTC on 15CF194 and 15CF209 to follow.  Court adjourned.  lw Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Atty. Andrea. gme
Pre-trial conference on May 20, 2015 at 11:15 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Broden F.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
